isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - Trailer Connection

entry.para: Remove and check fuse F7-D for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then correct. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F7-D. At fuse F7-D, circuit 14F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 14F and 14K, then repair.
Remove stop light relay from connector (464)/R10. At (464)/R10 measure voltage at circuit 70E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70E, then repair.
At (464)/R10 measure voltage from circuit 70E to 70-G.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 70-G if left turn indicator functions, or circuit 56-G if turn indicator does not function. Check 57-G/11-G if right turn indicator does not function. Then repair faulty gnd. circuit.
Remove and check fuse F3-B for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then correct. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F3-B. At fuse F3-B, circuit 14E measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 14H and 14E, then repair.
Disconnect stop light switch connector (640). At (640) and circuit 70 measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70, then repair.
With brake pedal depressed, measure resistance across terminals of stop light switch.
Reconnect (640) and disconnect (4). With brake pedal depressed, at (4) measure voltage from circuit 70A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70A, then repair.
Reconnect (4). With brake pedal depressed, at (464)/R10 measure voltage from circuit 70D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70D, then repair.
At (464)/R10 use test lead to jumper circuit 70E to 70C.
With test jumper still in place, measure voltage at trailer socket (112) red terminal/circuit 70C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C, then repair.
Replace defective stop light relay. Stop light circuits check good.
Proceed with this test only if tractor turn signals, hazard flashers and indicators work properly. Do turn, hazard, and indicator lights of tractor function properly?
Remove turn signal flasher, and use test lead to jumper between circuits 55 and 55A.
With left turn signal switch on, measure voltage at trailer socket (112) yellow terminal/ circuit 56C or 56D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56C or 56D, then repair.
With right turn signal switch on, measure voltage at trailer socket (112) green terminal/circuit 57C or to 57D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57C or 57D , then repair.
Test complete; remove test jumper at flasher and re-install flasher unit.
Proceed with this test only if tractor tail lights work properly. Do tail lights of tractor function properly?
With head light switch on or in parking light mode, and cab and trailer lights switch on, measure voltage at trailer socket (112) brown terminal/circuit 68A or 68B to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68A or 68B, then repair.
Tail lights circuit checks good. Turn off headlight switch.
Proceed with this test only if tractor tail lights work properly. Do tail lights of tractor function properly?
Remove marker lights relay (463-R8). With trailer lights switch on and headlight switch on or in parking light mode, measure voltage at (463-R8) circuit 58C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58C, then repair.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair.
Re-install fuse F3-A. At fuse holder F3-A, measure voltage from circuit 14E to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14E, then repair.
At (463-R8) measure voltage from circuit 58D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58D, then repair.
At (463-R8) measure voltage from circuit 58D to 58-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 58-GA and 11-G, then repair.
At (463-R8) use test lead to jumper circuit 58D to 58R.
Measure voltage at trailer socket (112) black terminal/circuit 58A or 58R to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58A or 58R, then repair.
Replace defective trailer marker lights relay. Marker light circuits check good.
Measure voltage between blue terminal circuit 94AF of trailer socket and ground.
Blue terminal circuit 94AF of trailer socket & gnd.
Remove and check fuse F10-A for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition and correct. Replace fuse.
Replace fuse F10-A. Remove ABS trailer relay (470). Turn key on and measure voltage between circuit 94AH and ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 94AH or 14CP, then repair.
Measure the voltage between circuits 13-GCP and 13CP at connector (470).
Locate open in circuit 13-GCP or 13CP, then repair.
Remove fuse F-10A and install a jumper between circuits 94AH and 94AF at (470). Install F-10A and measure the voltage between blue terminal, circuit 94AF, of trailer socket and ground.
Between blue terminal, circuit 94AF, of trailer socket and gnd.
Locate open in circuit 94AF between (470) and the trailer socket, then repair.
Remove jumper and reinstall relay (470). Measure the voltage between blue terminal, circuit 94AF, of trailer socket and gnd.
Between blue terminal, circuit 94AF, of trailer socket.
With long test leads, measure resistance between left dash panel ground stud and white terminal of trailer socket (112).
Locate open or poor connection in ground circuit, then repair. NOTE: Refer to circuit diagram book for ground circuits which vary for different sleeper models.
